subject: Politics
title: Why Inequality Grows
description: A quick win: understand Why Inequality Grows.

hook.text: The richest 1% own more wealth than the bottom 50% combined. Inequality isn't an accident â€” it's structural.

buildup.text: Thomas Piketty showed that when returns on capital exceed economic growth, wealth concentrates at the top.

discovery.text: Since the 1980s, wages stagnated while profits and asset prices soared. Workers fell behind investors.

twist.text: Technology amplifies inequality. One app can replace millions of jobs. The gains go to founders and investors.

climax.text: Political power follows wealth. The rich shape tax policy, regulation, and trade rules in their favor.

punchline.text: Inequality feeds itself. Wealth buys power, and power protects wealth.

quiz.question: What did Thomas Piketty's research show about inequality?
options: When returns on capital exceed economic growth, wealth concentrates at the top
Inequality naturally decreases over time in all economies
Government spending is the sole cause of inequality
